channel.title: Comments on: The Submissive Ache: Wanting and Waiting
channel.description: BDSM, books and missing links by Xiao Yingtai

item.title: By: jadescastle
item.dc:creator: jadescastle
item.description: Yes, yes, yes. To all of this. <3
item.content:encoded: Yes, yes, yes. To all of this. <3

item.title: By: Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/the-submissive-ache/#comment-38">Dumb Domme</a>.
LOL! You know us all too well. But that's what's going on in our heads, anyway. :p
You are reminding me of Guy Baldwin. Somewhere in his book, <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Ties-That-Bind-Leather-Commentaries/dp/1881943097/" rel="nofollow">Ties That Bind</a>, he says that both partners are communicating and driving the scene, it's just that the top's communication is mostly verbal and the bottom's mostly non-verbal. It sounds so simple-minded, but I think it's one of those unspoken assumptions that Explain So Much when things go wrong.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Dumb Domme.

LOL! You know us all too well. But that’s what’s going on in our heads, anyway. :p

You are reminding me of Guy Baldwin. Somewhere in his book, Ties That Bind, he says that both partners are communicating and driving the scene, it’s just that the top’s communication is mostly verbal and the bottom’s mostly non-verbal. It sounds so simple-minded, but I think it’s one of those unspoken assumptions that Explain So Much when things go wrong.

item.title: By: Dumb Domme
item.dc:creator: Dumb Domme
item.description:
<i>he managed to describe the very similar feeling you get once you do find your dom. Wanting so badly, and yet it’s unthinkable to demand their attention.</i>
Unthinkable to <i>demand</i> attention, perhaps. But it's not at all unthinkable to <i>elicit</i> or <i>encourage</i> attention. :) From my very limited experience, you submissive types have your sneaky ways of getting what you want. (and thank goodness for that!).
item.content:encoded:
he managed to describe the very similar feeling you get once you do find your dom. Wanting so badly, and yet it’s unthinkable to demand their attention.

Unthinkable to demand attention, perhaps. But it’s not at all unthinkable to elicit or encourage attention. :) From my very limited experience, you submissive types have your sneaky ways of getting what you want. (and thank goodness for that!).
